Options: A. ask questions B. count to ten C. costume D. state name E. dress herself

The question asks what you should ask a child to do when you first meet her. The provided options are:

A. ask questions  
B. count to ten  
C. costume  
D. state name  
E. dress herself

Given the context of establishing a friendly rapport with the child, the most appropriate action would be to have the child "state name" (option D). This is because asking a child to state their name is a common and friendly way to start a conversation and get to know them better. It helps in making the child feel acknowledged and comfortable in the interaction.
